citation.article-title: Reassignment of Enterobacter dissolvens to Enterobacter cloacae as E. cloacae subspecies dissolvens comb. nov. and emended description of Enterobacter asburiae and Enterobacter kobei.

p.s: Description of E. cloacae subsp. dissolvens comb. nov. (formerly E. dissolvens [2])
The following description is based on the data collected on four isolates of E. cloacae subsp. dissolvens in the course of the present study.

The description is that of E. cloacae subsp. cloacae with the following differentiating characteristic: While E. cloacae subsp. cloacae is negative in the esculin test, E. cloacae subsp. dissolvens is positive (Table 4).

All strains produced a Bush class 1 β-lactamase (AmpC), two at a basal level conferring resistance to ampicillin, ampicillin plus clavulanic acid and cefoxitin but not to the other antibiotics tested.

Two strains hyper-produced the AmpC additionally conferring resistance to piperacillin, piperacillin plus tazobactam, cefotaxime and ceftazidime, but not to cefepime, gentamicin and trimethoprim plus sulfamethoxazole.
The type strain of the subspecies is ATCC 23373T (CIP 105586, JCM 6049, LMG 2683), which was isolated from maize [2].
The G+C content of the DNA is 55 mol%.
The GenBank accession numbers of the 16S rDNA sequences is Z96079.
